article_title: Saturday expected to be the hottest day of the year in Denver – The Denver Post
article_text:
Grab a towel and head to the pool, turn on the air conditioner or find another way to stay cool — Saturday was the hottest day of the year so far.

The National Weather Service reported that the temperature hit 96 degrees at Denver International Airport just before 4 p.m., making it the hottest day of 2014.

The previously recorded hottest day in Denver this year was 94 degrees on June 26.

The normal high for the date is 88 degrees and the record high for July 5 is 101, recorded in 1989.

Corrie Sahling: 303-954-1223, csahling@denverpost.com or twitter.com/corriesahling

The normal high for the date is 88 degrees and the record high for July 5 is 101, recorded in 1989.
